Detailed Description

This class is a helper class, specifically for use as a button.

Unlike rectangles and captions, this class can be interacted with by clicking. It is important to understand what you want your space to do when selecting the class to use.

void phys::UI::Button::EnableUserSprite ( bool  Enable  )  [virtual]

Enables(or disables) the currently set User sprite.

Parameters:
Enable If true, this will swap the current sprite with the user sprite, if false it will swap the User sprite for the normal sprite.

bool phys::UI::Button::GetMouseHover (  )  [virtual]

Gets the stored value of whether or not the mouse is over the button.

This function does not perform any checks. If you want to do a manual check, call CheckMouseHover().

Returns:
Returns the stored value of whether or not the mouse is over the button.

void phys::UI::Button::SetButtonCallback ( ButtonCallback *  Call  )  [virtual]

Sets the callback for this button. See the ButtonCallback class for more info.

You can pass in a null pointer to disable a callback.
